intro: Cyanea ferox var. horrida, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to deep red. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii. It has rough, hairy leaves and produces capsules that contain numerous seeds. This species is notable for its ecological importance and is often found in coastal scrub habitats.
